subject: 🎁 Wrapped: all the new features of '24.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Expect 10x in '25.͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌

Looking Back to Look Forward

It is a bit late in the month for a retrospective. But it took us a while to collate everything that we did last year.

🪄 We added 38 features to the dashboard. A fair few of them were major ones. (Hello, advanced monitoring!)

💥 We blocked billions of attacks on sites. We wrote articles about the 21 biggest ones.

🧑🏻‍🤝‍🧑🏾 We sponsored and participated in the flagship WordCamps, and several local ones.

🔟 We had our first team member hit their 10-year milestone.

What to expect in 2025?

✨ We always focused on function, with new and improved features coming out every month. We have neglected the design though. But we are fixing that. Our first (big!) reveal of 2025 will be a brand new dashboard.

PS: We're happy to hear feedback and usage, so hit reply if you would like to weigh in.

🤩 ...and many more things!

25,000 Sites Have a Need for Speed

Performance optimization is no joke.

😵‍💫 Ask a marketer who has to deal with Pagespeed recommendations.

😵 Ask a site admin who has to manually convert PNG files to WebP.

😡 Ask a developer who has to mess about with CSS and JS files.

😭 Ask a designer who has to remove the video from the hero.

That's why we built Airlift.

One-click performance for all WordPress sites.

One-click? If performance optimization is so hard, then how can it be one-click?

Because all the work goes into Airlift's analysis engine. Which is to say, it is powerful but invisible.

Even so, we did add some features you can see on the dashboard: converting fonts, optimization controls, and font subsetting.

We launched Airlift late 2023. Since then, 25,000 sites use it to ramp up performance.
Try it out now

Introduced Advanced Monitoring
­

How do you keep an eye on your sites without keeping an eye on your sites? Monitoring.

Uptime monitoring, by this time, is par for course. Site goes down? You get an alert.

But advanced monitoring is where it is at.

Advanced monitoring is a suite of features that checks different aspects of your site, so you don't have to.

You don't need to track registrar emails, hosting emails, or log into multiple accounts to make sure which one needs renewing.

Advanced monitoring does it all for you.

🗒️ Page loads, but is blank? Page content monitoring.

🙅‍♂️ Design is off? Visual monitoring.

🚫 Site showing an untrusted error? Expired SSL certificate needs renewal.

🚧 Site vanished without a trace? Registrar took it down when the domain expired.

👹 Weird errors showing up on your site? PHP error monitoring gives clarity.


We also added basic form testing for major WordPress form plugins, and expanded compatibility to others soon after.

Visual Regression For WordPress

Site updates are a pain.

The biggest problem arises when things break on a site. So after every major update, you have to check the site.

Visual regression testing checks screenshots before and after an update, and finds the smallest difference.

That's why having it in the update workflow is a gamechanger.

When a theme update moved everything on a site by 1 px...

When a theme update disrupted custom CSS...


...visual regression testing is the way we found out.

We're serious. Gamechanger.

Safest WordPress Updates
­

We've spoken of how visual regression testing has improved updates. We also added other ways to make updates easier.

🔎 UpdateLens was our breakout feature for plugin updates. It does differential analysis for new releases, and scores it for risk.

⚙️ We've long had the feature to set auto-update schedules from the dashboard. And we long had 3 ways to run updates. We combined both.

🔔 A refined notification system will keep you posted, in case there is an issue with any update.


🗃️ WooCommerce updates also got streamlined into one step. You can now set the database to update with the plugin.

We Changed the Paradigm of WordPress Security

Atomic Security is a reimagined WordPress firewall. It fortifies sites intelligently, rather than relying exclusively on patching.

Atomic Security in action

In 2024, Atomic Security prevented all kinds of exploits. Here are the major vulnerabilities that could have been exploited:

❌ Cross-scripting attacks (XSS) in Popup Builder, Litespeed Cache, WordPress Core, WP Members, and Yoast SEO

🕹️Remote code injections (RCE) in Bricks Theme Builder and WPML

🔐 Privilege escalation attacks in RegistrationMagic, User Registration, Login/Signup Popup, Litespeed Cache, and Post Grid and Gutenberg Blocks

💉 SQL injection attacks in Layerslider, Icegram Express, and WP Activity Log

🛸 PHP object injections in GiveWP, Ultimate Membership Pro, and FluentSMTP

🔏 Authorization bypass in Really Simple Security, WPForms, and CleanTalk

Vulnerabilities and panic

We typically announce the major vulnerabilities: number of sites affected, severity of the vulnerability, or number of exploits we witness.

🔟 Having said that, there are a lot of times CVSS and similar scores don't always reflect the severity accurately. It is always important to keep sites updated as a consequence.


🧿 Hackers are always innovating, but so are we.

🚨 In 2024, we saw a slew of plugins fail to show updates because of changed plugin slugs. We now send alerts for those changes.

In other security news

📋 We revamped our firewall and security report. It was easy to secure a site before, but now it is child's play.


🛁 After cleaning malware from a site, you need to reset WordPress keys, reset user passwords, and clear the site cache. You can set those to happen automatically from your dashboard.

🔑 We added two-factor authentication for WordPress logins as well. It is an extra layer of login security.

☝️ Sifting through firewall logs got easier, with better filters to zero in on exactly what you need.


⚛️ Atomic Security's XSS rules got an upgrade as well, stopping many millions of exploits in their tracks.

AI bots raid more than content

The rise of AI was inevitable. But it is having a larger impact than just stealing content.

­
Read more

Reimagined Client Reports
­

Reports are an important touchpoint to showcase behind-the-scenes work to customers. But how many of them read it?


✨ With our redesigned summary email, we've seen open rates skyrocket. It is highly customizable to include information that customers care about.

💆 We also gave the security section a facelift. It better conveys how the firewall has stopped attacks in its tracks, and shows the effort behind cleaning up site malware.

📬 Additionally, with recent Google and Yahoo spam guidelines, you can ensure deliverability with DKIM and DMARC verification.


🔎 Finally, find any report quickly and easily with a centralized dashboard, complete with filters.

Now With API Access!

Some people swear by the command line.

For them, we released API access. We continue to add functionality and documentation as well.

Dashboard Optimizations
­

🔔 Notifications saw a huge overhaul last year. You can completely customize notifications to receive and where. We also added notifications for Manage tasks, so there's no need to babysit running operations.


💬 Have multiple people managing sites? Leave contextual notes for team members right on the site dashboard. We've also added audit logs for transparency and accountability on who does what on the site dashboard.

💸 Each site is different, and so its maintenance should reflect that. We added per-site pricing to give you full flexibility to decide which sites require which features.

🧪 Testing PHP compatibility on staging? We keep adding new versions of PHP to staging, but we also added an easy switcher toggle.

🎨 Customize WordPress login pages right from the dashboard. Easily add logos and messaging that reflects the rest of the site.


✅ Also check out our recommendations. We have shared our favourite plugins from the WordPress ecosystem.

Morpheus: A WordPress Mirror

Many of our customers feared losing access to updates, so we quickly spun up a mirror of the WordPress repository. In a time of crisis, we responded to the need of the hour.

PS: We also added support for off-repo plugins: GravityPDF and ACF.

WordCamps, Celebrations & More

Thank you to you all for 2024. Cheers to 2025! (At least to the 11 months that are left.)
­

Liked the newsletter? Have feedback? Prefer something different?
Hit reply and let us know. We read every single reply.
